greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of ways n can be written as k^2 * j, 0 < j <= k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: a(18) = 1 because 18 = k^2 * j, j <= k, in one way: k=3, j=2.
mathematica: t = Sort[ Flatten[ Table[k^2*j, {k, 11}, {j, k}]]]; Table[ Count[t, n], {n, 105}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 22 2005 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Feb 21 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 22 2005
